notes: Please place all papers, except cardboard, in the mixed paper bin.  Please rinse cans, bottles, jars, and containers clean.  Keep plastic bags clean and separate from other materials.  This program does not accept soiled paper, soiled cardboard, styrofoam, motor oil containers, chemical containers, broken glass, light bulbs, dishes, glasses, Pyrex, window glass, or auto glass.  Call for more information on computer and television disposal.  Residents with a Recycling Permit will be charged a fee to dispose of white goods, electronics, or wood.  There will be no charge for Landfill Permit holders.  Large branches and stumps are not accepted.

notes:
This is a registered redemption center collecting beverage containers under the Massachusetts Bottle Deposit Law.  Waverly Redemption Center redeems all beverage containers at the full deposit value.  



Waverly Redemption Center, a subsidiary of FLOW, Inc. (Fernald League Opportunity Workshops), is a non-profit organization that employs developmentally disabled adults.  They assist many charities with their can drive needs and provide pick-up service for local companies.
